info.title: The Selling Partner API for Amazon Seller Wallet Open Banking API
info.description: The Selling Partner API for Seller Wallet (Seller Wallet API) provides financial information that is relevant to a seller's Seller Wallet account. You can obtain financial events, balances, and transfer schedules for Seller Wallet accounts. You can also schedule and initiate transactions.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Everything about Amazon SW customer accounts

tags.name: Transfer Preview
tags.description: Access to all transfers with fees and the final amount with FX details in Amazon SW

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Access to all transactions in Amazon SW account

tags.name: Transfer Schedule
tags.description: Access to all transfer schedules in Amazon SW account

get.summary: Fetch potential fees that could be applied on a transaction on the basis of the source and destination country currency code
get.description: Returns list of potential fees on a transaction based on the source and destination country currency code

parameters.name: sourceCountryCode
parameters.description: Represents 2 character country code of source transaction account in ISO 3166 standard format.

parameters.name: sourceCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Represents 3 letter currency code in ISO 4217 standard format of the source transaction country.

parameters.name: destinationCountryCode
parameters.description: Represents 2 character country code of destination transaction account in ISO 3166 standard format.

parameters.name: destinationCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Represents 3 letter currency code in ISO 4217 standard format of the destination transaction country.

parameters.name: baseAmount
parameters.description: Represents the base transaction amount without any markup fees, rates that will be used to get the transfer preview.

addressLine1.description: Address Line 1 of the public address

addressLine2.description: Address Line 2 of the public address

city.description: City name of the public address

state.description: State name of the public address. This is the state or region for China-based addresses.

postalCode.description: Postal code of the public address

country.description: Country name of the public address

countryCode.description: The two digit country code, in ISO 3166 format.

AccountHolderAddress.description: Address for bank account verification of the Payee. For example, this can be a person or business mailing address

accountId.description: The unique identifier provided by Amazon to identify the account

accountHolderName.description: BankAccount holder's name (expected to be Amazon customer)

bankName.description: The name of the bank, for all Amazon Seller Wallet account the value will be Amazon Seller Wallet

routingNumber.description: Routing number for automated clearing house transfers, for all Amazon Seller Wallet account the value will be denoted by nine cosecutive 0's,

accountCountryCode.description: The two digit country code, in ISO 3166 format.

accountCurrency.description: BankAccount currency code in ISO 4217 format

bankAccountNumberTail.description: Last 3 digit of the bank account number, for all Amazon Seller Wallet account the value will be three consecutive 0's

BankAccount.description: Details of an Amazon SW bank account, used to hold money earned by a SW customer by selling items. NOTE: Not including account_links, short cut links to the account balance and transactions -> since not mandatory

BankAccountListing.description: Struct that holds collection of accounts.

accountId.description: The unique identifier provided by Amazon to identify the account

balanceCurrency.description: The Amazon SW bank account currency code in ISO 4217 format

lastUpdateDate.description: The last update date on the account balance

Balance.description: Specifies the balance amount in the Amazon SW bank account

balances.description: Collection that holds list of balances on the account

BalanceListing.description: Struct that holds list of balances on the seller account.

BalanceType.description: Represent a bank account balance type.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Available balance that is accessible to the seller.
The incoming balance in sellers account.
The outgoing balance from sellers account
Total balance in the sellers account.

BankAccountNumberFormat.description: The format of the bank account number.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: International Bank BankAccount Number.
Basic Bank BankAccount Number which is Domestic bank accounts.

BankAccountHolderStatus.description: Represents status of the Amazon Seller Wallet accountholder

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: BankAccount holder is Active.
BankAccount holder is Inactive and cannot be used for transactions.
BankAccount holder is currently under review.
BankAccount holder KYC(Know Your Customer) verification has failed.

BankAccountOwnershipType.description: Represents destination bank account's ownership type.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: BankAccount is not officially owned by the Payment Service User who is viewing the account and initiating the transaction.
BankAccount officially owned by the Payment Service User who is viewing the account and initiating the transaction.
BankAccount officially owned by some Government entity and is used for service fee / tax collection.

BankNumberFormat.description: Represents a format of a bank number also called routing number type

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Business Identifier Code. In ISO 9362 format.
Basic means the bank number has a special format specific to the country code provided, such as ABA routing number.

BigDecimal.description: A decimal number such as amount or FX rate.

currencyCode.description: The three-digit currency code in ISO 4217 format.

code.description: A success code that specifies the delete operation was successful. eg:HTTP 200.

message.description: A message that describes the success condition of the delete schedule transaction.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand the operation execution.

DeleteTransferSchedule.description: Response returned when the schedule transfer's delete request is successful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

fxRateId.description: Unique identifier assigned to the fees/foreign exchange Rate of a transaction.

FxRateDetails.description: Foreign exchange rate details displayed when transfer preview is requested.

feeId.description: Unique identifier assigned to the Fee.

Fee.description: If the fees is in baseAmount (sourceAccount) currency, effectiveRate =  (baseAmount - sum(fees.feeAmount.currencyAmount)) * baseRate) / baseAmount. If the fees is in transferAmount (destinationAccount) currency, effectiveRate =  (( baseAmount * baseRate ) -  sum(fees.feeAmount.currencyAmount )) / baseAmount

FeeType.description: Represents different types of fees that can be applied on a transaction.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Represents any other service charges or additional fee applied by a transaction executor service.
Represents tax fees if applied on any transaction.
Represents a per transaction fee that can be applied by a transaction executor service. This can be both INTERNATIONAL and DOMESTIC fees

RateDirection.description: Represents the rate direction at which the transaction is performed.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Buy value represents the rate if customer is buying the source currency.
Sell value represents the rate if customer is selling the source currency.

PaymentPreference.description: Payment preference type in which transfer is being scheduled

PaymentPreferencePaymentType.description: Represent a type of payment preference.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The schedule transfer in percentage.
The schedule transfer in amount value.

RecurringFrequency.description: Represent parameters to specify recurrence of the scheduled transfer.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The transfer repeats every two weeks.
The transfer repeats every day.
The transfer repeats every month.
The transfer repeats every week.

scheduleStartDate.description: Field to specify start date of the scheduled transfer

scheduleEndDate.description: Field to specify end date of the scheduled transfer

TransferScheduleInformation.description: Parameters containing information required for initiating a schedule transfer

ScheduleExpression.description: Parameters containing information of the expression that defines when the schedule runs. The following formats are supported.

ScheduleExpressionType.description: Represent a type of schedule transfer expression.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The schedule transfer is a recurring event. example: monthly schedule transfer.
Creates a one-time schedule transfer.

ScheduleTransferType.description: Defines the type of schedule trigger used for executing transfers. Schedule based on time patterns using EventBridge.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Schedule based on time patterns using EventBridge. Supports recurring patterns (daily, weekly, biweekly, monthly) and one-time future executions.

sourceAccountId.description: The unique identifier of the source Amazon SW bank account from where the money needs to be debited

destinationAccountId.description: Optional field to specify the unique identifier of the destination bank account where the money needs to be deposited

description.description: Optional field to specify description for the transaction

requestTime.description: The transaction initiation request time in date-time format

TransactionInitiationRequest.description: Request body to initiate a transaction from a SW bank account to another customer defined bank account

bankAccountNumber.description: This field would be used to populate the bank account number of the destination payment method. The field is intentionally not included in any other Schemas since Amazon internal systems will never receive it in unencrypted format, so field won't be part of the request signature

TransactionInstrumentDetails.description: Request body to create transaction instrument, Amazon performs validation and screening (anti-money laundering measuers) on all the transaction instruments before executing a transaction thus it requires transaction instrument holder's contact details as well

transactionId.description: The unique identifier provided by Amazon to the transaction

transactionRequestDate.description: The date when the transaction was initiated.

expectedCompletionDate.description: Expected completion date of a transaction, for existing active Payees (Trusted Beneficiaries) it will be 24 hours but for new destination bank accounts the value could go up to 5 days

lastUpdateDate.description: The last update date on the transaction

requesterName.description: Amazon SW customer who requested the transaction

transactionRequesterSource.description: The transaction initiation source. This value is either the Amazon portal or PISP name that the customer used to start the transaction.

transactionDescription.description: A description of the transaction that the requester provides when they initiate the transaction.

transactionFailureReason.description: Description in case the transaction fails before completion

Transaction.description: The current transaction status and related historical details.

accountId.description: The unique identifier provided by Amazon to identify the account

bankAccountNumberTail.description: Last 3 digit of the bank account number

bankAccountCountryCode.description: The two digit country code, in ISO 3166 format. This field is OPTIONAL for transactionSourceAccount object but is MANDATORY field for transactionDestinationAccount

bankAccountCurrency.description: The currency code in ISO 4217 format

TransactionAccount.description: Details of the bank account involved in the transaction.

nextPageToken.description: If present, use this pagination token to retrieve the next page of supply sources, if not provided the API will return same response. The field will only be provided when the list is greater than 100.

TransactionListing.description: Struct that holds collection of transactions.

TransactionStatus.description: Represents current status of the transaction.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Transaction failed before completion.
Transaction failed after debit and credit has been applied back to the balance.
Transaction is requested but not started yet.
Transaction is in progress.
Represents that the destination account holder (beneficiary) is under review.
Transaction is successfully processed.
Money is deposited into the Seller Wallet account.
Money is taken out of the Seller Wallet account.

TransferRatePreview.description:
The fees and foreign exchange rates that apply to the transaction.

If the fees are in terms of the `baseAmount` (source account) currency, then the effective rate is equal to **1 - (fees * `baseRate` / `baseAmount`)**.

If the fees are in terms of the `transferAmount` (destination account) currency, then the effective rate is equal to **`baseRate` - (fees / `baseAmount`)**.

In the preceding expressions, **fees** is equal to the sum of all `feeAmount.currencyAmount` values in the `fees` array.

transferScheduleId.description: The unique identifier provided by Amazon to the scheduled transfer

transferScheduleFailures.description: Collection that holds Transfer Schedules that has been cancelled or failed due to certain reasons.

TransferSchedule.description: Transfer schedule details and related historical details.

transferScheduleFailureReason.description: The statement/reasoning listed for the cancellation of the transfer schedule

TransferScheduleFailures.description: Specifies the balance amount in the Amazon SW bank account

nextPageToken.description: If present, use this pagination token to retrieve the next page of supply sources, if not provided the API will return same response. The field will only be provided when the list is greater than 100.

transferSchedules.description: Collection that holds list of Transfer Schedules

TransferScheduleListing.description: Struct that holds collection of transfer schedules.

sourceAccountId.description: The unique identifier of the source Amazon SW bank account from where the money needs to be debited

sourceCurrencyCode.description: Represents 3 letter currency code in ISO 4217 standard format of the source payment method country

destinationAccountId.description: Optional field to specify the unique identifier of the destination bank account where the money needs to be deposited

TransferScheduleRequest.description: Request body to initiate a scheduled transfer from a SW bank account to another customer defined bank account

TransferScheduleStatus.description: Represents the schedule status of the transfer.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Represents the status of the transfer schedule that is enabled.
Represents the status of the transfer schedule that is disabled.
Represents the status of the transfer that has expired and not scheduled anymore.
Represents the status of the transfer that was scheduled but has been deleted.
